Remarks on the resilience of the students who have resumed their studies in Japan. Relays the experience of NZ firefighter Paul Rodwell who rescued Japanese students from the CTV building."

Author: "Robertson, Emily-Kate"
Title: "Dance student's fortunate decision before the earthquake hit; A name to remember; Massive upheaval; Home"
description: "Presents essays, a poem and an original work of art from six pupils at Bayfield High School. Relates the stories of two people, including a former pupil, who survived the 6.3 magnitude earthquake in Christchurch, 22 Feb 2011, as told by Emily-Kate Robinson and Victoria Saunders. Describes the qualities of her friend, a popular Swedish student named Agnes, who has since returned to Sweden. Includes the poem 'Home' by Britta Hamill, and a pop art work and commentary by Joshua Hunter."

Author: "Porteous, Debbie"
Title: "Earthquake through police lenses"
description: "Talks to the police forensic photographer about his experience in the aftermath of the 22 Feb 2011 Christchurch earthquake, images of which have been published in the book 'Christchurch 22.2 : Beyond the cordon / through the eyes of New Zealand Police photographers', featuring photographs by about 20 forensic photographers in the weeks following the earthquake."

Author: "Hartevelt, John"
Title: "Crying for cover"
description: "Covers the state of the insurance industry in NZ. Reports on a NZ delegation to Europe to meet with reinsurers, noting remarks by Earthquake Recovery Minister Gerry Brownlee about resulting increases in reinsurance costs. Warns of the effect of insurance companies currently withholding cover to Christchurch businesses and individuals. Touches on the Government's financial support of AMI Insurance."

Author: "Bradley, Antonio"
Title: "Inside the red zone"
description: "Showcases some of the work of police photographers in the wake of the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake in Christchurch. Notifies of the publication of a book featuring images taken inside the red zone, 'Christchurch 22.2: Beyond the cordon: Through the eyes of New Zealand police photographers'. Cites comments about demeanour of the Japanese urban search and rescue team."

Author: "McBride, Kerry"
Title: "Earthquakes haven't stopped the music"
description: "Earthquakes haven't stopped the music"

Author: "Wright, Michael"
Title: "Couple at 'end of tether' after insurance drama"
description: "Talks to St Martins couple Barry Chapman and Carole Chapman about their dealings with Tower Insurance following disagreement over whether their house could be rebuilt following damage in the Christchurch earthquakes."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Rising from the rubble"
description: "Traces the steps that Perpetual Trust has taken to recover from the deaths of 10 employees in the 22 Feb earthquake, talking to CEO Patrick Middleton. Announces the company has opened a new office in Addington, Christchurch, after its premises in the PGC building were destroyed. Relays the surviving employees' experiences of the earthquake and their post-quake recovery."

Author: "McKenzie-McLean, Jo"
Title: "The woe of hair today but gone tomorrow"
description: "Investigates the phenomenon of hair loss among Canterbury residents following the earthquakes in Christchurch. Presents facts on the condition known as alopecia. Talks to Gendi Roberts, Ashleigh Calvert and Janine Antram about coping with hair loss. Talks to Ms Antram about her wig provider business and the possible causes of alopecia. Mentions a service payment available for people who need wigs and hairpieces."

Author: "Williams, David"
Title: "In the poo ; The estuary a toilet bowl again"
description: "Investigates the condition of the Avon-Heathcote Estuary following the Christchurch earthquakes. Describes the research being carried out on the water and algae at the estuary. Remarks on the resilience of the locals and researchers to the smell and contamination. Gives a short history of wastewater treatment in Christchurch. Informs of the amount of untreated sewage and wastewater that has entered the area's rivers, estuary and sea. Gauges the effect of the Christchurch earthquakes on estuarine health, noting the role played by liquefaction. Presents an environmental forecast for the area."

Author: "Le Cocq, Jonathan"
Title: "Singing words"
description: "Reviews three concerts that remembered the recent earthquakes, 'Christchurch sings' (4 Sep), 'Christchurch memorial' (25 Sep) and 'NZSO odes to joy' (27 Sep), which were part of the Christchurch Arts Festival (12 Aug to 2 Oct)."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Gas-laden basin a big bonanza?"
description: "Informs of the corporate interest in the hydrocarbon potential of the Canterbury basin. Talks to spokesperson for the Texas oil company Anadarko Alan Seay about its drilling plans. Names the other oil and gas companies interested in obtaining permits for the area. Discusses the Government's goal to increase exploration and production investment, citing the comments of Energy Minister Gerry Brownlee on the size and exploration potential of NZ's large exclusive economic zone (EEZ). Looks at the content of the proposed EEZ and Contintental Shelf (Environmental Effects) Bill aimed at managing the effects of offshore exploration activities. Reports criticism of the new Environmental Protection Agency and its ability to mitigate any drilling related disasters. Explains the role of the Ministry for the Environment and Maritime New Zealand in policing NZ's EEZ. Relays the reaction to offshore exploration of Christchurch mayor Bob Parker and conveys his focus on promoting energy efficiency through the Christchurch Agency for Energy (CAfE)."

Author: "Watkins, Tracy"
Title: "Big issues take toll"
description: "Lists significant issues which have had political ramiifications including the Christchurch earthquake, return of global financial woes, Hone Harawira splits from the Maori Party, changes in the Act political party, Darren Hughes quits, John Key goes to the White House ... etc."

Author: "Le Cocq, Jonathan"
Title: "Christchurch sings review"
description: "Reviews three concerts that remembered the recent earthquakes, 'Christchurch sings' (4 Sep), 'Christchurch memorial' (25 Sep) and 'NZSO odes to joy' (27 Sep), which were part of the Christchurch Arts Festival (12 Aug to 2 Oct)."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Small shoots for changing palate"
description: "Features the Greengold Gardens at Halswell, Christchurch, talking to owners Paul Clark and Heather Clark about their business growing salad greens which they supply to chefs throughout the South Island. Chats about the changes in NZ eating habits, the current demand for microgreens, and their weathering the Christchurch earthquakes."

Author: "Jones, Nicholas"
Title: "Bali quake sends Kiwi teacher flying"
description: "Bali quake sends Kiwi teacher flying"

Author: "Clements, R. T."
Title: "Mainland bounces back from quake"
description: "Presents an analysis and forecasts for the South Island economy. Talks about global concerns undermining business confidence, improved consumer confidence, increased house sales and consents, unemployment, and CPI (consumer price index) inflation."

Author: "Steeman, Marta"
Title: "Mainland monitor : city council business divide"
description: "Looks at the troubled relations between the Christchurch City Council and the business community over the city's rebuild after the 2010 and 2011 earthquakes. Talks to some critics of the council's draft city plan."

Author: "Jenkin, Lydia"
Title: "Quake in your boots"
description: "Talks to the band about their debut album."

Author: "Mussen, Deidre"
Title: "Small-town jurors feel earthquake pressure; Jury trials to be held at former barracks site"
description: "Reviews the impact on jurors and the justice system after Christchurch courthouses were put out of action after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Talks to a businessman, local residents, the Ministry of Justice, lawyers and Corrections officials about the implications of having to shift all trials from Christchurch to other South Island cities and towns. Informs that jury trials will resume in a temporary complex on the old King Edward Barracks site in the Christchurch CBD from early 2012."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "At last, doors to open in the city"
description: "Talks to the chairman of the Restart the Heart Trust about the Re:Start project aimed at rebuilding the retail sector in the ruined city centre. Discusses the new retail area that will open to the public on 29 Oct 2011, made of repurposed shipping containers. Mentions a new Augmented Reality (AR) phone application developed at the University of Canterbury that will be released on the same day, allowing people to 'see life-sized virtual models of buildings ... where the real buildings used to be'.  Talks about the psychological impact of the earthquakes and their aftermath on residents, and the challenge of creating an economically viable city in partnership with property owners and the Christchurch City Council. Overviews his interest and experience in city revitalisation beginning in the late 1970s."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Fabric of memory falling to pieces; Fabric of memory falling to pieces in the demolished city centre"
description: "Focuses on the psychological impact for residents of Christchurch who will soon be re-entering an empty central city that has been demolished and cleared of earthquake debris. Observes that our memories, emotions and experiences help to form our mental pictures of cities, and when buildings are demolished or rebuilt in a short time it has a 'devastating effect' on these mental images. Includes remarks from design historian Douglas Lloyd Jenkins, writer Martin Edmond and others about their response to major changes to city architecture in Auckland, Sydney and elsewhere, and cites comment from Islay McLeod, Bruce Russell and Adrienne Rewi about the Christchurch CBD."

Author: "Killick, David,"
Title: "Heritage preserved"
description: "Features 'Otahuna', a historic homestead in Canterbury designed by architect Frederick Strouts and built in 1895 by Sir Heaton Rhodes. Talks to one of the co-owners about the challenge of rebuilding the homestead, now a boutique luxury accommodation venue, after the earthquakes of 4 Sep 2010 and 22 Feb 2011. Traces the history of the homestead."

Author: "Peka,  June"
Title: "Industrial growth"
description: "Talks to the former childhood neighbours from Ryan St, Linwood, Christchurch. Focuses on their work to transform the driveway of their workplace, Gary Clarke Plastics, into an attractive garden environment after the company suffered liquefaction damage."

Author: "Benson, Nigel"
Title: "'Remarkable New Zealander' who made things happen"
description: "Pays tribute to the late operatic tenor and sports administrator. Praises his administrative ability in a variety of sectors, including organising a benefit concert for Christchurch earthquake relief headlined by friend Placido Domingo."

Author: "Killick, David,"
Title: "Heritage preserved"
description: "Features 'Otahuna', a historic homestead in Canterbury designed by architect Frederick Strouts and built in 1895 by Sir Heaton Rhodes. Talks to one of the co-owners about the challenge of rebuilding the homestead, now a boutique luxury accommodation venue, after the earthquakes of 4 Sep 2010 and 22 Feb 2011. Traces the history of the homestead."

Title: "New Vero chief grasps the nettle"
description: "Speaks to newly appointed chief executive of insurance company Vero in NZ, Gary Dransfield, about how the 2010 and 2011 Canterbury earthquakes changed the property investment scene around the country."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Rush to ruin; Newcastle rising"
description: "Looks at the demolition of buildings in Christchurch, especially heritage buildings, and reports on criticism that this is unnecessary. Sketches the scale of demolitions and reports on international engineers Kit Miyamoto and Michael King's claims that many of the buildings could have been fixed for 20%-30% of the cost of new buildings. Discusses reasons why Christchurch owners might seek exaggerated damage estimates and settlements for demolitions through the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority (CERA). Reports on the urban renewal of Newcastle in NSW following an earthquake and other urban revitilisation efforts in Australia."

Author: "Blundell, Sally,"
Title: "Christchurch's heritage buildings are a "must keep"; Newcastle rising"
description: "Looks at the demolition of buildings in Christchurch, especially heritage buildings, and reports on criticism that this is unnecessary. Sketches the scale of demolitions and reports on international engineers Kit Miyamoto and Michael King's claims that many of the buildings could have been fixed for 20%-30% of the cost of new buildings. Discusses reasons why Christchurch owners might seek exaggerated damage estimates and settlements for demolitions through the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority (CERA). Reports on the urban renewal of Newcastle in NSW following an earthquake and other urban revitilisation efforts in Australia."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Running on empty"
description: "Looks at the long-term toll the Canterbury earthquakes are taking on many people around Christchurch and Canterbury. Talks about the recognised sequence of psychological stages that follow a natural disaster like an earthquake. Speaks to Professor Bruce Glavovic of the Massey University Joint Centre for Disaster Research and Christchurch Mayor Bob Parker about the mental recovery process, and to a number of residents, including Don Elder, Solid Energy chief executive and spokesman for the Christchurch Business Leaders' Group, about their experiences."

Author: "Rothwell, Kimberley"
Title: "From the inside"
description: "Talks to the columnist about life in the early days of the post-earthquake city, as depicted in her columns and a new book 'Old Bucky & me : dispatches from the Christchurch earthquake'."

Author: "Kilty, Robyn"
Title: "Nature runs wild"
description: "Talks about how a lack of human intervention due to the Christchurch earthquakes has not stopped her garden from flourishing. Notes the various roadside wild plants that she sees around Flaxmere and Hawarden."

Title: "Reflecting on 150 years : 2011"
description: "Looks at news and events as they were recorded by the newspaper in early 2011. Covers the aftermath of the Christchurch 22 Feb earthquake, giving updates for 19 Mar and 14 Jun (23 Feb); the earthquake and tsunami on Japan's northeast coast, including a 16 Mar update on the nuclear radiation leaking from a Fukushima atomic power plant (12 Mar); and the wedding of Prince William and Kate Middleton at Westminster Abbey, UK, (30 Apr). Includes brief articles on the death of Osama bin Laden, a windstorm in Dunedin and the opening of the Forsyth Barr Stadium in Dunedin."

Author: "McMurran, Alistair"
Title: "Respected as inspirational athletics coach"
description: "Pays tribute to the late athlete, coach and sports administrator who was killed in the Christchurch earthquake, 22 Feb 2011. Talks to associates about the impact of his loss to athletics."

Author: "Hunt, Tom"
Title: "Lucky to be alive, says woman hurt in quake"
description: "Lucky to be alive, says woman hurt in quake"

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Patchwork of village conversations"
description: "Investigates whether the Christchurch City Council is listening to local communities such as Sumner and Lyttelton in its handling of suburb earthquake recovery plans. Seeks comment from Jenny Ridgen, the city council planner responsible for the suburban centres programme, about the council's master plans for Sydenham and Lyttelton. Talks to local residents of Lyttelton and Sumner about  their frustrations with the slow pace of the recovery."

Author: "Samson, Alan"
Title: "Memories of an idyllic childhood"
description: "Reflects on his upbringing in the suburb of Brooklands during the 1960s. Comments on the Government decision to designate the community as being in the 'red zone', which will wipe the village from the map."

Author: "Wood, Alan"
Title: "Helping Chch rise up; Busy building a vision for Christchurch, project by project"
description: "Talks to the man who is emerging as a rebuild entrepreneur for the region through the business owned by his family trust. Discusses the challenges and opportunities that have come after the Canterbury and Christchurch earthquakes.  Focuses on the Re:Start retail project in Cashel Mall, Christchurch, constructed from shipping containers, and other construction projects and priorities in the city. Seeks comment from Registered Master Builders chief executive Warwick Quinn."

Author: "Anstiss, Celeste Gorrell"
Title: "Award finalist inspired by quake-bereaved student"
description: "Award finalist inspired by quake-bereaved student"

Author: "Fisher David"
Title: "Sperm-donor father kept his wife in the dark"
description: "Reports how American politician Bill Johnson, who has spent most of this year in Christchurch helping run the earthquake recovery, has been meeting women online who want help to get pregnant, without telling his wife or the individual women concerned about what he was doing. Looks at the concerns raised by his actions as a sperm donor in the fertility medicine community, whose guidelines recommend donations are made in the regulated environment of a fertility clinic, and that no man provide sperm donations to more than four families. Highlights the complexity of fertility law. Talks to his wife, Kathy Johnson, about her reaction to the news."

Author: "Weekes, John"
Title: "Brave teen put body on line"
description: "Talks to the recipient of a Community Hero award for his efforts in wedging himself between his severely injured aunt and a collapsed chimney after the Feb 22 Christchurch earthquake."

Author: "Dowden, Peter"
Author (detailed): "Peter Dowden, Charmian Smith and Hamesh Wyatt"
Title: "Before Christchurch, there was Wellington's quake; Engaging story of food and life; Collection proof poet can get better with age"
description: "Before Christchurch, there was Wellington's quake; Engaging story of food and life; Collection proof poet can get better with age"

Author: "Heather, Ben"
Title: "PGC building's susceptibility known; disregarding it cost 18 lives in quake"
description: "Examines the findings so far of the Canterbury earthquakes royal commission into the structure of the Pyne Gould Corporation building which collapsed partially in the Feb 2011 earthquake. Outlines strengthening measures carried out since 1966, reports from individual occupants on the building's status after the September 2010 earthquake, and points out differing interpretations of the term earthquake 'safe'. Presents a visual sequence of the building's collapse."

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Teachers unsung heroes"
description: "Acknowledges the part played by Christchurch teachers in the aftermath of the Feb 22 2011 earthquake. Looks at the uncertainty schools and teachers face in the face of dropping rolls and damaged school buildings. Speaks to New Zealand Principals Association Peter Simpson about other issues facing schools: primary school league tables, competition in a co-operative profession, charter schools, widening gaps in student ability, and lack of consultation with government officials."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Lego man puts blocks in place"
description: "Presents divergent opinions on the performance and design of the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority (CERA). Talks to Cera chief executive Roger Sutton about the perceptions, his views of the organisation's structure and powers,  the people he has chosen for his management team, and the pace at which the group is proceeding. Focuses on general manager of operations Warwick Isaacs, who is responsible for signing off the demolition of Christchurch buildings. Chronicles the history of the organisation since the Sep 2010 earthquake."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "A religious divide"
description: "Reports on the resignation of the Dean of Christ Church Cathedral Peter Beck and the suggestion that he fell out with Bishop Victoria Matthews over the future of the cathedral, which was severely damaged in the Feb 2011 earthquake. Talks about the break down in relations between church leaders and the Christchurch City Council heritage staff over the building. Presents a brief history of the cathedral."

Author: "Moore, Christopher"
Title: "Curtain to rise at new theatre"
description: "Reports Christchurch's Court Theatre will begin a new life in a new location in Bernard Street, Addington after the old theatre in the Christchurch Arts Centre was destroyed in the February 22, 2011 earthquake."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Excessive chat, not much voice?"
description: "Charts the progress of a community forum, a cross-section of Christchurch people, set up by Earthquake Recovery Minister Gerry Brownlee as his official sounding board, one of three checks and balances on his ministerial powers."

Author: "Cole, Charles"
Title: "Bookseller yearns to be back"
description: "Talks to owner of Smith's Bookshop, Barry Hancox about his plans to restart his business as soon as is practicable. Smith's Bookshop had become a Christchurch institution but was destroyed in February's earthquake where it had been trading and the business had been going since 1894."

Author: "Stock, Rob"
Title: "Insurance landscape rocked"
description: "Writes how household cover in NZ has changed forever after the sequence of earthquakes in Christchurch in the past 15 months."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Powering up"
description: "Discusses Christchurch in terms of its most influential people, suggesting that power struggles have been affected by the 2010 and 2011 earthquakes. Briefly profiles the following twelve people, describing their roles in the rebuilding of Christchurch following the earthquakes: Gerry Brownlee, Roger Sutton, Tony Marryatt, Bob Parker, Mark Solomon, Andrew Holden, Dame Margaret Bazley, Don Elder, Peter Townsend, David Meates, Bruce Irvine, and Rod Carr."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "Student rallied thousands for quake clean-up army"
description: "Student rallied thousands for quake clean-up army"

Author: "Matthews, Philip"
Title: "Who were our local heroes?"
description: "Spotlights the local heroes that have helped and made a difference to earthquake ravaged Christchurch during the past year."

Title: "A word in your ear"
description: "Asks the following NZers what they were doing at age 20 and what advice they would give that younger self: food writer Annabel Langbein, Labour MP David Cunliffe (48), satirist John Clarke (63), broadcaster Mike Hosking, broadcaster Paul Holmes (61), Christchurch mayor Bob Parker (58), chef and food writer Alison Holst (73), musician Dave Dobbyn (54), photographer Marti Friedlander (83), playwright Roger Hall (72), MP and former broadcaster Maggie Barry (52), artist Dick Frizzell (68), scientist Sir Ray Avery (64), film-maker Vincent Ward (55), former All Black captain Sean Fitzpatrick (48), and novelist Lloyd Jones (56)."

Title: "NZ figures give advice"
description: "Asks the following NZers what they were doing at age 20 and what advice they would give that younger self: food writer Annabel Langbein, Labour MP David Cunliffe (48), satirist John Clarke (63), broadcaster Mike Hosking, broadcaster Paul Holmes (61), Christchurch mayor Bob Parker (58), chef and food writer Alison Holst (73), musician Dave Dobbyn (54), photographer Marti Friedlander (83), playwright Roger Hall (72), MP and former broadcaster Maggie Barry (52), artist Dick Frizzell (68), scientist Sir Ray Avery (64), film-maker Vincent Ward (55), former All Black captain Sean Fitzpatrick (48), and novelist Lloyd Jones (56)."

Author: "Jones, Lawrence"
Title: "Tackling the monster without : 'Landfall' on quakes"
description: "Reviews the issue themed 'Christchurch and beyond', noting the ongoing editorship of David Eggleton."

Author: "Lovell-Smith, Mary"
Title: "A different kind of garden"
description: "Looks at how various Christchurch home gardens are faring after the earthquakes."

Author: "O'Sullivan, Fran"
Title: "Shearer's message just what Kiwis needed"
description: "Takes up David Shearer's view that a beautiful NZ is not enough to keep young NZders home to build a career, nor is it enough to attract talented overseas people here. Comments on David Shearer's predisposition to support 'innovative government policies and work in a bi-partisan fashion'. Notes the continuing earthquakes in Christchurch will affect the government's ability to plan for economic development and the euro crisis is not having a positive affect either."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Demolition derby"
description: "Details the demolition of buildings in Christchurch's central business district. Talks to engineering experts about the lessons learned from the collapse of CBD buildings during the Christchurch earthquakes. Focuses on soil composition, adequacy of engineering standards, and the danger of poorly designed reinforced concrete buildings. Registers criticism of the Canterbury Earthquakes Royal Commission membership and some of its findings so far on the collapse of the Pyne Gould Corporation (PGC) building."

Author: "Mackenzie, Dene"
Title: "Jade succeeding with push into great unknown"
description: "Spotlights the winner of the 'Otago Daily Times' Southern Business of the Year. Talks to its managing director Craig Richardson about the challenges of carrying out its three-year plan after the Christchurch earthquakes, and its successes, including the establishment of an office in San Francisco."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Fracture friction"
description: "Discusses the exploration of oil and gas using fracking.  Defines the process, explaining why it is regarded as unconventional.  Sets out its contribution to the US energy industry. Explains the reasons for controversy over the practice in the US and Australia. Differentiates the chemicals used by exploration companies in NZ.  Provides an illustration of the engineering method used in NZ.  Talks to L&M Energy managing director Kent Anson about the company's applications to mine coal seam gas in Canterbury. Documents the resistance by Taranaki farmers Sarah Robert and David Morrison to fracking by Canadian based Tag Oil. Talks to American geophysicist Michael Hasting about links between fracking and earthquakes and asks if the procedure should be used in Canterbury.  Reports on groundwater contamination close to the Kapuni gas fields, where gas is extracted by Shell Todd Oil Services.  Relays concerns voiced by individuals and groups in NZ, and passes on the warning from the spokesman of Apache, a US based company operating on the North Island East Coast."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Fracking New Zealand"
description: "Discusses the exploration of oil and gas using fracking.  Defines the process, explaining why it is regarded as unconventional.  Sets out its contribution to the US energy industry. Explains the reasons for controversy over the practice in the US and Australia. Differentiates the chemicals used by exploration companies in NZ.   Provides an illustration of the engineering method used in NZ.  Talks to L&M Energy managing director Kent Anson about the company's applications to mine coal seam gas in Canterbury. Documents the resistance by Taranaki farmers Sarah Robert and David Morrison to fracking by Canadian based Tag Oil. Talks to American geophysicist Michael Hasting about links between fracking and earthquakes and asks if the procedure should be used in Canterbury.  Reports on groundwater contamination close to the Kapuni gas fields, where gas is extracted by Shell Todd Oil Services.  Relays concerns voiced by individuals and groups in NZ, and passes on the warning from the spokesman of Apache, a US based company operating on the North Island East Coast."

Author: "Guild, Ben"
Title: "To insure or not to insure?"
description: "Delves into the philosophy of the insurance industry, focusing on its importance and some of its shortcomings in the wake of the Christchurch earthquakes. Seeks comment from Waitaki District Council strategy group manager Richard Mabon, who provided a report to the council about its insurance options. Talks to Oamaru Whitestone Civic Trust chairman Phil Hope and Vicar Tim Hurd of St Luke's Anglican Church, Oamaru, about the options they have investigated for the properties in their care."

Author: "McLean, Elspeth"
Title: "Earthquakes teach unexpected lessons; Loath to move back to centre"
description: "Talks to the businessman and former clinical psychologist, co-owner of four gift stores in Christchurch with partner Anita Cessford, about the impact of the Christchurch earthquakes on the retail chain and the lessons they have learned. Discusses the earthquake on Boxing Day 2010 that led to the City Mall store in the CBD being 'red-stickered', which in hindsight was a 'fortunate' occurrence. Describes the effects of the earthquakes on staff and his own experiences with bureaucracy and insurance companies. Explains the decision not to reopen shops in the central city."

Author: "Barton, Chris"
Title: "Legacy at risk as city crumbles"
description: "Reports on the tough decisions heritage experts face in central Christchurch after the 2010 and 2011 earthquakes. Speaks to Christchurch Arts Centre director Ken Franklin about the reality of the situation for the complex, architectural historian and heritage planner Jenny May about the loss of memory of the city, and University of Canterbury Associate Professor in Art History Ian Lochhead about the concerns surrounding the hasty demolition of heritage buildings."

Author: "Stewart, Tamlyn"
Title: "At the sharp end of recovery"
description: "Focuses on the work of Recover Canterbury. Provides three case studies (Winnie Bagoes, Embrayce Skin and Beauty, and High Speed Doors) to illustrate how the organisation helps local business owners battling with post-earthquake issues. Explains how business owners can get help."

Author: "Steeman, Marta"
Title: "Cera leads the way to recovery"
description: "Talks to Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority (CERA) economic recovery general manager Steve Wakefield. Names and backgrounds the business and government members of his team, and lists and discusses the team's economic priorities for 2012. Remarks on the level of international and local interest in investing in the Christchurch CBD, and on the decision of two Government departments to locate out of the CBD."

Author: "Ihaka, James"
Title: "Terrified mum feels trapped in quake zone"
description: "Terrified mum feels trapped in quake zone"

Author: "Constantine, Ellie"
Title: "Refuge as busy as ever in hard times; Women's refuge : inside a safe house"
description: "Spotlights the work of Te Whare Pounamu Dunedin Women's Refuge. Talks to residential services manager Darlene Gore and residential services worker Kerri Oliver about the increased demand for their services in the wake of the recession, stress and the Christchurch earthquakes. Visits a safe house in Dunedin and talks to Kerri Oliver about the property. Provides facts about the refuge for those who want to help, or are seeking help."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Bringing down powers that be"
description: "Investigates the crisis that is ripping apart the Christchurch City Council (CCC). Speaks to protest organiser Peter Lynch, the Reverend Mike Coleman, leader of the Wider Earthquake Communities' Action Network (WeCan), former developer Hugh Pavletich, and Christchurch Mayor Bob Parker about the issues that have led to a public protest outside the council offices and the demand for emergency mid-term local government elections in the city. Talks about the controversy around CCC chief executive Tony Marryatt's $68,000 pay rise."

Author: "Eleven, Beck"
Title: "Let the children play"
description: "Speaks to three Christchurch families about the changes in the behaviour of their children after the 22 Feb earthquake and the ongoing aftershocks, and to child and family psychologist Melanie Patterson about the Journey of Hope programme that is designed to create more resilient children. Provides tips for how to deal with mild anxiety in children."

Author: "Booker, Jarrod"
Title: "From the quake, a gift of life to a sister"
description: "From the quake, a gift of life to a sister"

Author: "Small, Vernon"
Title: "Shake-up heading in EQC's direction; Quakes blow benchmark"
description: "Speaks to Earthquake Recovery Minister Gerry Brownlee and EQC (Earthquake Commission) chief executive Ian Simpson about how an upcoming review of the scheme will affect the insurance cover of householders. Talks to Ian Simpson about why the Canterbury earthquakes have not changed the commission's view of its worse-case scenario for Wellington in relation to how much money it will need in reserves."

Author: "Carville, Olivia"
Title: "Quake survivor shows the miracle of the body"
description: "Speaks to the earthquake survivor about her recovery from multiple injuries caused by being crushed beneath the rubble of the City Mall."

Author: "Small, Vernon"
Title: "Rippling aftershocks; Evaluating the EQC one year on; Wellington quake would spark 150,000 claims"
description: "Speaks to Earthquake Recovery Minister Gerry Brownlee and EQC (Earthquake Commission) chief executive Ian Simpson about how an upcoming review of the scheme will affect the insurance cover of householders. Talks to Ian Simpson about why the Canterbury earthquakes have not changed the commission's view of its worse-case scenario for Wellington in relation to how much money it will need in reserves."

Author: "Wood, Alan"
Title: "Airport build a boost for city"
description: "Speaks to Christchurch International Airport chief executive Jim Boult, who is also chairman of the Christchurch and Canterbury Tourism partnership, about the role of the airport in the region. Reports on the progress of the Christchurch International Airport's domestic terminal rebuild."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Postcards from Christchurch"
description: "Considers the city's recovery one year after the devastating 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Tells the recovery stories of a number of residents: red-zoners Jenny and Allan Faulkner, and Regan and John Helsloot, community builder Marnie Kent, business owner Ange Leonard, artistic director Ross Gumbley, heritage owner and entrepreneur Alan Slade, and kiosk owner Ian Carter."

Author: "MacFie, Rebecca"
Title: "Christchurch one year on"
description: "Considers the city's recovery one year after the devastating 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Tells the recovery stories of a number of residents: red-zoners Jenny and Allan Faulkner, and Regan and John Helsloot, community builder Marnie Kent, business owner Ange Leonard, artistic director Ross Gumbley, heritage owner and entrepreneur Alan Slade, and kiosk owner Ian Carter."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Inside CTV's collapse; 'A miracle has happened and I have not survived to abandon my dreams. More than ever it was a time to live now';"
description: "Describes the time leading up to, during and a short time after the February 22, 2011 Christchurch earthquake by some of those who worked in the Canterbury Television building."

Author: "Anderson, Vicki"
Title: "Time traveller's wife"
description: "Recounts Christine Murray's experience of being inside the PGC building in Christchurch when the February 22 earthquake struck, how she was help out of the building and how her husband Stephen, eventually managed to locate her at Christchurch Hospital. Describes the museum they run and own (The Time Machine) which has items of popular culture memorabilia and nostalgia."

Author: "Williams, David"
Title: "He was God's little ray of sunshine; The brave companion of a man who was doomed to die"
description: "Follows the experience of attempting to extricate Carey Bird from the much damaged Pyne Gould Corporation building after the Christchurch February earthquake. Tony McCormick who work in the PricewaterhouseCoopers building at the time of the February 22, 2011 Christchurch earthquake and finds himself helping out in that attempt."

Author: "Van Beynen, Martin"
Title: "Miracle under rubble; 'Oh my God, you are alive'"
description: "Describes the time leading up to, during and a short time after the February 22, 2011 Christchurch earthquake by some of those who worked in the Canterbury Television building."

Author: "Cooke, Michelle"
Title: "Paraplegic quake surviviors' lives tougher to rebuild"
description: "Paraplegic quake surviviors' lives tougher to rebuild"

Author: "Price, Mark"
Title: "Picking up the pieces"
description: "Visits Christchurch a year after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake to report on the progress of the recovery effort. Talks to digger driver Craig Bugden about his work to demolish about 100 homes over the past year. Speaks to business administrator Diane Hale-Fielding, one of the few remaining residents in the suburb of Pacific Park, Bexley, about her experiences of the 4 Sep 2010  and the 22 Feb 2011 earthquakes. Presents his impressions of the desolation of the central business district. Seeks comment from Warwick Isaacs and Roger Sutton of the Canterbury Earthquake Recovery Authority (CERA), landscape architect Di Lucas and Christchurch Central City Business Association manager Paul Lonsdale about opportunities presented by the rebuilding process. Talks to chef Karl Lau about the uncertainty he faces with his bed and breakfast establishment."

Author: "Williams, Ian,"
Title: "Survivors' perspective of Feb 22 quake poignant; Dark online elements of plot fail to quite hit spot"
description: "Survivors' perspective of Feb 22 quake poignant; Dark online elements of plot fail to quite hit spot"

Author: "Bayer, Kurt"
Title: "It was a miracle : survivor; Selfless actions saved 4 lives; [Christchurch - a year on]"
description: "Talks to the mother who was trapped after the CTV building collapsed in the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake about her 'miracle' rescue. Speaks to her rescuer, who she nominated for a Christchurch Earthquake Award for his valour, about rescuing her and three other people."

Author: "King, Caroline"
Title: "Saved woman's identity mystery to rescuer; [Christchurch - a year on]"
description: "Speaks to the North Canterbury contractor who rescued a woman from the CTV building after the 22 Feb 2011 earthquake. Recounts how he nearly lost his own life when the earthquake struck while he was working on the Trinity Presbyterian Church, which had been damaged in the 4 Sep 2010 earthquake."

Author: "Cairns, Lois"
Title: "We'll close more buildings, say quake engineers"
description: "Reports building engineers are being more cautious in their inspection of damaged buildings in Christchurch in the light of information coming out of the royal commission. Comments on the time frame within which the engineers are having to make decisions about a building's structural integrity and the implications of being very conservative on the Christchurch rebuild."

Author: "McCrone, John"
Title: "Double acts in the city; CEO convinced city needs him"
description: "Looks back on the city's recent series of leadership partnerships involving Christchurch City Council (CCC) mayors and their chief executive officers (CEOs), including Vicki Buck and Mike Richardson through the 1990s, Garry Moore and Lesley McTurk through most of the 2000s, and the current team of Bob Parker and Tony Marryatt. Talks about the current row over the CCC leadership. Speaks to CCC CEO Tony Marryatt about the ongoing agitation against his reappointment."

Author: "Collins, Simon"
Title: "Rate of departure abates; Life becomes normal but effects are lasting; Family ties convince couple to stay; [Christchurch - a year on]"
description: "Examines life in the city one year after the devastating earthquake on 22 Feb 2011. Provides statistics showing that the rate of departure from the city has slowed. Talks to two families about their respective decisions to leave and remain in Christchurch."

Author: "Berry, Michael"
Title: "City's rebirth begins; Building foundations over top : developer"
description: "Reports on why few commercial landowners are rebuilding in the city at present. Speaks to a number landowners, including developer Richard Diver, preschool teacher Joanna Beadle, Ferry Oak Properties Richard Peebles, and Edgeware SuperValue owner Stephen Anderson, about their frustrations and plans, and to Christchurch City Council earthquake building services manager Ethan Stetson about why some commercial building consents have been delayed. Talks to Consortium Construction foreman Shayne Chilton and Ferry Oak Properties developer Richard Peebles about the heavily strengthened and reinforced foundations for the new building on the corner of Moorhouse Avenue and Montreal Street."

Author: "Cropp, Amanda,"
Title: "Canterbury quake : one year on; My year of living warily"
description: "Writes of life in post-earthquake Christchurch and Sumner and the emotional aspects of earthquake recovery. Looks at some of the events and government processes that have become part of the 'anger and depression' recovery stage. Discusses the importance of recognising the gains along with the pains. Includes part of a timeline of events."

Author: "Wall, Tony"
Title: "Canterbury quake : one year on; Staying alive"
description: "Meets manager James Meharry and partner Karyn South, owners of the radio station RDU98.5FM in Christchurch. Talks about their experiences in the Feb 2011 earthquake and how they turned a horse truck into a mobile radio station and got their business back up and running. Includes part of a timeline of events."

Author: "Cairns, Lois"
Title: "Canterbury quake : one year on; 'Every day is tough'"
description: "Talks to David and Jeanette Beaumont, who lost their adopted son Matt when the CTV building collapsed, about their last memories of him. Includes part of a timeline of events."

Author: "Low, Nic"
Title: "Canterbury quake : one year on; 'Ear to the ground'"
description: "Describes the sound that accompanied the Christchurch earthquakes and the above-ground results of the shockwaves colliding. Explains what Christchurch sounds like now with the various rebuilding work that is being done. Includes part of a timeline of events."
